content.description:
Start in the same spot as

Black Ice

, on top of a 20-foot high boulder than leans against the main cliff. Step up onto a ledge about three feet off the large boulder (as for

Black Ice

). Climb straight up the black face directly above, keeping about 10 feet right of

Black Ice

and 6-8 feet left of

Icy, But Not Too Dicey

(the easy flake to the right).
content.protection: Need an anchor rope to set this up as a slingshot TR.
content.location:
Start in the same spot as

Black Ice

, on top of a 20-foot high boulder than leans against the main cliff. Step up onto a ledge about three feet off the large boulder (as for

Black Ice

).

content.description: Climb the first crack of "Nutcracker", then up the face past a bolt.
Climb a thin crack to the left of  "Nutcracker", then up past horizontal cracks and face with a bolt.

climbs.name: Nutcracker
climbs.fa: Rob Stahl, Dave Stahl, John Wolfe & Mona Wolfe, March 1971

content.description: This climbs a crack to a chimney about 20' right of "Event Horizon".

climbs.name: Lil Squirt
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Dave Evans, Margie Floyd, Cyndie Bransford

content.description: Short slab climb. Starts off a very thin flake up to 1st bolt then moves left on the face to the second bolt then up to easier face climbing. There are bolted rap anchors on top set way back that you can use if you extend them.
content.location: North face around the corner from Dunce Cap

content.description:
Start in the same spot as

Black Ice

and

Thin Ice

, on top of a 20-foot high bolder than leans against the main cliff. Step up onto a ledge about three feet off the large boulder (as for

Black Ice

and

Thin Ice

). Climb up and right along an easy, left-facing flake to its top. Make some unprotected friction moves above the flake to reach the summit.
content.protection: Small to medium gear protects the flake. You'll need an anchor rope to set this up as a slingshot TR.
content.location:
Start in the same spot as

Black Ice

and

Thin Ice

, on top of a 20-foot high bolder than leans against the main cliff. Step up onto a ledge about three feet off the large boulder (as for

Black Ice

and

Thin Ice

).

climbs.name: Horror-zontal Terror-verse
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger, Vaino Kodas & Andy Brown 10/86

content.description: This unique route traverses the amphitheater-like feature on Cap Rock. It starts on the left and follows a seam up and right past a bolt. It finishes with a steep exit move at a vertical crack below the "cap" of Cap rock. The gear is PG, not as bad as the name implies.
This climbs the thin flake to the right of "False Lieback".
This climbs the big right-facing corner  on the Northeast Face.
This climbs the left edge of the Northeast Face, past horizontals and face past a bolt.
content.protection: Standard rack, for lead. For TR, two bolts at top; suggest rigging extension.

climbs.name: Circus, Circus
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Rebecca Foster, October 1985

content.description: This climbs the left-leaning corner/crack on the far right side of  the North Face.

climbs.name: Circus
climbs.fa: Dick James and John Wolfe, December 1968

content.description:
This fun, easy crack is on the northwest corner of the rock, below the cap.

Descend to the right, 3rd class. Alternatively, rap from rings next to Ayatollah. Walk to the top of the formation, continue along the ridge passing the anchors for Ayatollah, and look to your left for the rap station.

Left of False Layback, start up a crack system immediately left of the dihedral. A combination of side pulls or fist jams can be used on this route. Once you reach a horizontal crack, use balance move to stand on it, then go up the large flake. Once the large flake starts getting thicker, make your way right again for more fist jams. Continue until you reach a small roof, traverse left and back to the rock face and go up a few feet. Large ledge on top. Optional variation (5.10c) if you start on your left side, directly underneath the large flake.
content.protection: Standard/Large rack. You will need cams between 2" to 4" and 3's and 4's to set up anchor and bring your second up.

climbs.name: Black Ice
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Brian Prentice, October 1985

content.description: Very short 1 bolt climb, approx 20 feet right of False Prophet (uses same start).
This is a Direct Start to Bush Eviction.  Begin about 20 feet right of Nutcracker and climb past a bolt to reach the crack of Bush Eviction.

climbs.name: The Ayatollah
climbs.fa: (TR) Mike Waugh 1979, FL: Bob Gaines & Tommy Romero, April 1997

content.description: Originally rated 11a on TR, this fine route is in the middle of the "amphitheater" on the upper north face. The climb begins as a thin crack that tapers to a seam where the first of three closely spaced bolts occurs. Powerful tips liebacking and high steps lead to the top. Clipping the bolts is tenuous / strenuous! Great rock - three out of five stars.
content.protection: Two or three small cams or TCU's plus quick draws for three bolts. A two bolt anchor with webbing is at the top.

climbs.name: Anniversary Special
climbs.fa: Bill Cramer and Mark Uphus, March 1989

content.description: This a good quality, somewhat runout thin face route.
content.protection: two bolts plus gear for the belay
content.location: This is just around the corner to the right from the north corner (right edge of the north face).
